newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine c.banker says new currency coming soon.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine c.banker says new currency coming soon.

text.p: Ukraine's central bank governor Viktor Yushchenko said the planned new hyrvna currency would be introduced soon.
"The hryvna will definitely be introduced by the end of the year," Yushchenko told reporters on Wednesday at a diplomatic reception.
Ukraine has repeatedly promised to introduce the hryvna since independence five years ago, but has had to postpone the permanent currency in past years because of economic problems.

But with the interim karbovanets currency stabilised and an International Monetary Fund mission in Kiev discussing a $1.5 billion fund to stabilise introduction of a new currency, speculation is growing that the hryvna could appear soon.
The Kiev Universal Exchange began futures trading in the hryvna on Wednesday.
A new currency can only be announced by President Leonid Kuchma and the parliamentary Currency Reform Committee.
